reason: All changes in this release are Comments-only (HTML/Vanilla SDK). The two improvements introduce no new API methods, props, hooks, events, or wireframe names that are currently taught by any skill rule. Improvement 1 (V4 backward compatibility aliases for allowAssignment, allowEdit, allowToggleNotification, allowChangeCommentAccessMode) adds aliases to existing props whose names do not appear anywhere in the velt-comments-best-practices skill library — no skill rule teaches OptionsDropdownProps prop-level names. Improvement 2 (edit composer wireframe reuse) is an internal rendering change with no wireframe name or API surface change; the affected wireframe names are not enumerated in any skill rule. All 12 bug fixes restore prior v4 behavior with no API or documented behavior change and therefore do not qualify under the guardrails. No CRDT or Notifications changes exist in this release.

itemsEvaluated.text: V4 custom wireframes that use property names allowAssignment, allowEdit, allowToggleNotification, and allowChangeCommentAccessMode now automatically resolve to their v5 equivalents. No changes to your wireframe code are required when upgrading from v4 to v5.
itemsEvaluated.rationale: Backward compatibility alias addition. No new API names for developers to learn or use. The alias prop names (allowAssignment, allowEdit, allowToggleNotification, allowChangeCommentAccessMode) do not appear in any skill rule. No skill rule references OptionsDropdownProps prop-level names. Backward compatibility means existing code continues to work — no developer action required, no skill guidance needed.

itemsEvaluated.text: The edit composer in comment thread cards now reuses the same velt-comment-dialog-composer-wireframe customization as the reply composer. Previously the edit composer always rendered the default template.
itemsEvaluated.rationale: Internal rendering change. No wireframe name changed, no new wireframe introduced. The wireframe names velt-comment-dialog-composer-wireframe and velt-comment-dialog-thread-card-edit-composer-wireframe are already present in existing product docs (comment-dialog-structure.mdx, comment-dialog-components.mdx) but are not referenced in any Comments skill rule. No API surface change.

itemsEvaluated.text: All 12 bug fixes (nested wireframe propagation, CSS class name restoration, mark-as-read, attachment download button visibility, attachment spinner crash, sidebar deselection guard)
itemsEvaluated.rationale: Bug fixes restoring v4 behavior. No new API methods, props, hooks, events, parameters, or wireframe names introduced. All fixes are internal behavioral corrections. Guardrails explicitly exclude bug fixes unless they change documented behavior taught by a skill rule — none of these do.
Zero changes to CRDT or Notifications in this release.
